sub_title: | Author, Medium | Entrepreneurship Advisor/Judge, UCalgary | Lecturer, Coordinator, Coach & Supervisor Creative Business, HU | Social Venture Fellowship Guide & Judge, The Resolution Project |
summary:
Expertise in: (Social) Entrepreneurship/Innovation, (Business) Coaching, Higher Education, Fashion, and Events

Main interests: Entrepreneurship, Innovation, Business, Strategy, Analysis, Quality, Performance, and Optimization

Enjoy contributing to: (Early-stage) Start-ups, Creative strategy/problem-solving, and Experiential Learning

Pursue(d) an International career throughout Europe, Asia, and Oceania:

Countries ( a - z ):
Australia, China, England, Germany, Hong Kong, the Netherlands, Portugal, Switzerland, and Turkey

Cities ( a - z ):
Amsterdam, Berlin, Istanbul, Kowloon, Lausanne, Lisbon, London, Melbourne, Rotterdam, Shanghai, and Utrecht

awards.title: FutureLearn Award for Social Enterprise 2018
awards.description: The FutureLearn Award underpins a developed understanding of what it takes to launch and run a sustainable social enterprise, having found out how to design a social enterprise model and bring it to market, and lastly, having explored how to scale, or sustain a social enterprise over the long term.

awards.title: Golden Key International Honour 2017
awards.description: The world’s largest premier collegiate honour society rewards top-performing postgraduate students, based solely on academic achievement. It assessed that based on my performance over 2016 - 2017, I ranked among RMIT University's top 15% academic achievement, as validated by The RMIT Chapter.

awards.title: Recognition Future Edge 2017
awards.description: Future Edge acknowledged my on- and off-campus co-curricular activities, including my contribution to the Australian Fashion industry, leadership initiatives within RAFS, participation in the RMIT Activator start-up hub / Accelerator program and Bloomberg market concepts accomplishment.

awards.title: Special Recognition RMIT LEAD 2016, RASCAL: RUSU Affiliated Student Clubs Accredited Leadership Program
awards.description: As an elected executive member of RUSU Affiliate Clubs, I received greater recognition for making a difference to individuals and communities in 2016, within my role as President & Co-Founder of RAFS, RMIT Association of Fashion Students, while participating in Leadership and Management trainings.

awards.title: Special Recognition RMIT LEAD 2017, RASCAL: RUSU Affiliated Student Clubs Accredited Leadership Program
awards.description: As an elected executive member of RUSU Affiliate Clubs, I received greater recognition for making a difference to individuals and communities in 2017, within my role as President & Co-Founder of RAFS, RMIT Association of Fashion Students, while participating in Leadership and Management trainings.

awards.title: Winner of The Nanu Challenge 2017 | VentureBlocks
awards.description:
RMIT University (Advanced Case Studies in Fashion Entrepreneurship)

After completing the self-guided 3D role-playing simulation, showing how to conduct informative interviews, create customer insights and identify potential business opportunities, my team got announced as the overall entrepreneurial winner, having achieved the highest potential score.

awards.title: Fashion Entrepreneurship Price 2016
awards.description: Out of the Fashion Entrepreneurship Finalists, my group's premium custom-made backpack concept Feasibility Project received the first price. The Analysis criteria covered five sections: the Business idea, the Industry and Market, Business model analysis, Future action plan(s) and conclusion(s).

awards.title: The Denimsmith Industry Engagement Award 2016
awards.description:
RMIT University (Product knowledge)

In close collaboration with Australian Garment Manufacturer Denimsmith, I co-developed a street style-inspired adjustable / sharable jean, which got awarded as no. 1 . The award certified the level of developing a brand idea, product development and application of contemporary Fashion research.

awards.title: Recommendation Branch Project Delivery Time Harmonisation 2014
awards.description: My co-research on E-Fashion and E-Fulfilment KPI's got rewarded for its contribution to a special grant program of the Dutch Ministry of Economic Affairs, which helped in investigating the feasibility and implementation criteria of a platform, to make Retail deliveries more efficient and demand-driven.
awards.issuer: VIM BV, TMO, Fashion Business School, Dinalog, Modint, Greenway Logistics

awards.title: Winning Product Concept 2013
awards.description:
NIMA / SWOT (Fashion Marketing study trip)

For a NIMA Design challenge, I co-developed a product idea for the FW14 Collection of Shanghai-based intermediary Online Design, living-up to the Design standards of their Major European Fashion clients. Our puffer jacket, based on a Moncler-inspired garment Design, was chosen as the winner.

awards.title: Innovation award 2013
awards.description:
TMO (final BBA project)

For the Business plan Project, I co-delivered 2013's Best Innovative Business Concept. The Business idea contained an (emergency) garment service for the Businessman / woman on the go. The main elements of the project focused on Trend forecasting, Marketing, Business, Finance and Research.

awards.title: Acknowledgment: Most Successful Junior Company 2009
awards.description:
IBC (final Research project)

For my PWS, I started together with two fellow IBC students my first social Enterprise in the Fashion industry. It supported emerging producers in Ethiopia and France and two international charities. Based on our Sales revenue, we got announced as the most successful Jr. Company of the nation.

profile_positions.description:
- Open social publishing platform where over 100 million readers come to find insightful and dynamic thinking written by creators, who dive into the heart of any topic and bring new ideas to the surface -

• Publish(ed) free, quick-insight publications of a maximum 5-minute read, to spark ethical, sustainable, commercial, and futuristic thinking among readers about: Economics, Web3, and Smart Cities

Achievements
- 2/4 first publications got tagged by Medium (hosts sites) amongst "the most insightful stories"
- 2/4 first articles got noticed by new upcoming publishing platform start-ups from the US and India
- My fourth article content, got picked up/reused by the American newspaper the Washington Post, which is the most widely circulated newspaper within the Washington metropolitan area

profile_positions.description:
- Global American NGO, fostering youth leadership/Social Entrepreneurship through Social Venture Challenges and Resolution Fellowships, supporting Undergraduate students, who lead/pursue socially responsible solutions through their own social start-ups, affecting local communities around the world -

• Work(ed) with HE (Alumni) Social Entrepreneurs from: South(east) Asia and Northwestern Europe; Social Venture challenge Entrepreneurs selected by: Harvard University: the World Model United Nations and the National Model United Nations, the Clinton Global Initiative University and One Young World

- Advisory start-ups in Europe:
Strategic decision-making, Business/Management Efficiency, Data Analytics, Project coordination, Operations, Marketing, Sales, Financial modeling, Outreach, and Partnerships

- Advisory start-ups in Asia:
Business Strategy, Business models, Sales channels, Prototyping and testing, Merchandise, Production, Customer Acquisition, Marketing, Concept validation, Market Research, and HR

• Collaborate with Sr. staff from leading Technology and Professional service multi-nationals on: Youth Leadership Development, Ad Hoc Fellowship communication, and Impact Reporting

• Judge at the Harvard University: World Model United Nations at the SVC Forum and Finals assessing: 
venture eligibility criteria and prospective fellow eligibility criteria of Indian and Nepali social ventures

• Reviewed Action Plan Applications from African Social Ventures for the Mastercard Foundation Scholars Program on viability in order to select semifinalists for the Baobab Summit, Resolution's largest SVC

Sectors: Agriculture, Energy, Education, Social Work, Health & Wellness, and Medical aid
Venture stages: Ideation stage, Early Start-up stage, and Early Scale-up stage
Operating regions: West Africa, East Africa, South and Southeast Asia, and Northwestern Europe
Focus: Human-centred products/services addressing social welfare and equal basic needs

Workshop about: Ableism, situational human behavior, sample testing & concept evaluation

Advisory sectors: Education, Food, Labour participation, Coffee, Greenery, Fashion, Public Debate, Marketing, Waste Collection, Outdoor, Beauty care, Bags, and E-commerce

- Supported Futureproof through proof of concept for its second subsidy until 2024
- 100% of the Cities and Programmes I contributed to were able to continue from 2022
